comment.author: 44731447@N00
comment._content: Looks like they are traveling up Broadway.  Trinity Church (Episcopal) is on the right.

comment.author: 46317563@N04
comment._content: The Empire building was built on the site of the Arcade Blg., where on December 4th, 1891 Henry L. Norcross ,a Boston broker entered the office of Russell Sage the multimillionare moneylender demanding a huge sum of money,threatening to blow everyone up. Sage pushed his $20 a week clerk named Laidlaw at the extortionist and made a dash for the door. Norcross dropped the ten lbs. of dynamite , blowing himself up, killing a bystander and injuring several others. Laidlaw sued Sage, won a $40,000 judgement after a lengthy court battle. However, Sage appealed the decision against him. In the end Laidlaw received nothing.
